page.title: 19SPRING WOOD:UPMINSTER
page.content: Spring Wood,is about 15 ha. & is an important{ancient woodland & marsh, which is awaiting{S.S.S.I.}listing. The{Essex Naturalist Trust}manage it & have laid out a{nature trail}in the {conservation area.} It lies in a shallow valley floored by impermeable{London Clay.}On both sides of the valley are{river gravels}which collect & drain rainwater down to the clay in the valley bottom.In the damp conditions{an alkaline peat fen}has formed with a varied plant assemblage. There is{Hazel & Alder coppice}with standard{Oak,& Hornbeam:also Ash which {may be the biggest in East England. Shrubs include{Spindle,Dogwood Guelder {Rose,& both types of Hawthorn_Midland {& Common.}It is a{vital floral refuge & most{important local ammenity}being in the most cultivated part of the Green Belt.
